title: Container Inner - Usage Examples
description: Comprehensive usage patterns for the modern flexbox inner container block. This block is a child of tp-container and provides extensive flexbox layout controls as an alternative to the legacy tp-row/tp-column structure.

examples.name: Basic 2-Column Flexbox Layout
examples.description: Simple 2-column layout using flexbox with center alignment
examples.visualDescription: Two equal-width columns side by side (50% each), centered vertically, 20px gap between them. On mobile: stack to full width (100%). Clean white background with subtle padding.
examples.useCase: Two-column content sections, side-by-side cards, split content layouts

examples.name: 3-Column Flexbox Grid with Gap
examples.description: Three equal-width columns in a flexbox grid with consistent gaps
examples.visualDescription: Three 33.33% columns in a row with 30px gap between each. On tablet: 2 columns (50%). On mobile: stacks to full width. Light gray background with rounded corners.
examples.useCase: Feature lists, service cards, team member grids, product showcases

examples.name: Centered Content Container
examples.description: Full-width container with centered content both horizontally and vertically
examples.visualDescription: Purple gradient background spanning full width, content centered both horizontally and vertically. Minimum height 400px creates visual presence. White text with generous padding.
examples.useCase: Hero sections, CTA sections, centered announcements, feature highlights

examples.name: Flex Reverse Layout (Desktop → Mobile Order)
examples.description: Content that reverses order on different screen sizes using flex-direction reverse
examples.visualDescription: On desktop: Image on right, text on left (reverse). On tablet: Normal order (text, then image). On mobile: Stacks vertically. 40px gap, subtle border.
examples.useCase: Alternating content sections, image-text combos, feature showcases with varying layouts

examples.name: Responsive Flex Direction (Row → Column)
examples.description: Layout that changes from horizontal row to vertical column on smaller screens
examples.visualDescription: Desktop: Horizontal row with items side by side. Tablet: Still horizontal. Mobile: Vertical stack. Each child gets equal space on desktop, full width on mobile.
examples.useCase: Navigation menus, button groups, stat counters, icon lists

examples.name: Flex Wrap Grid (Cards Layout)
examples.description: Card grid that wraps items to new rows automatically using flex-wrap
examples.visualDescription: Cards arranged in flexible grid that wraps based on available space. 25px gap between all cards. Items have equal height (stretch). Wraps gracefully on smaller screens.
examples.useCase: Blog post grids, product cards, portfolio items, image galleries

examples.name: Sticky Sidebar Container (Pro)
examples.description: Sidebar that sticks to viewport while scrolling (Pro feature)
examples.visualDescription: 30% width sidebar on desktop with sticky behavior. Stays 100px from top when scrolling. White background with shadow. Disabled on tablet and mobile (full width, no sticky).
examples.useCase: Sticky navigation menus, table of contents, sidebar widgets, floating CTAs

examples.name: Per-Child Flex Control (Advanced)
examples.description: Advanced layout with individual flex controls for each child block
examples.visualDescription: Container with 3 children: First child shrinks (flex-shrink: 1), second child grows to fill space (flex-grow: 1), third child has fixed basis (flex-basis: 200px). Creates dynamic responsive layout.
examples.useCase: Complex dashboards, custom layouts, header/content/footer sections, priority-based content display

examples.name: Space-Between Layout with Center Alignment
examples.description: Items distributed with maximum space between them, centered vertically
examples.visualDescription: Children spread across full width with equal space between them. Vertically centered. Perfect for headers with logo + menu + CTA button. Light background with border.
examples.useCase: Page headers, navigation bars, footer layouts, toolbar sections

examples.name: Full-Width Gradient Container with Clickable Link
examples.description: Full-width clickable container with gradient background and hover effect
examples.visualDescription: Full-width purple-to-blue gradient container with white text. Entire container is clickable (wrapLink). Hover state darkens gradient with smooth transition. Rounded corners and shadow create depth.
examples.useCase: CTA sections, clickable banners, promotional blocks, feature highlights with links

validationRules.Width: Required. Responsive object with md/sm/xs values. Default: {md: 50, sm: 50, xs: 100, unit: '%'}
validationRules.block_id: Required. Unique identifier for the block.
validationRules.flexGap: Space between flex items. Recommended: 15-30px for desktop, 10-20px for mobile.
validationRules.stickycol: Requires stickyDes, stickyTab, or stickyMob to be true. Requires topSpace and botSpace for offset.
validationRules.sttopoffet: Top offset for sticky positioning. Different from topSpace (which is bottom offset). Default: {md: '0', unit: 'px'}
validationRules.flexChild: Requires showchild: true. Array of per-child flex controls (flexShrink, flexGrow, flexBasis, flexselfAlign, flexOrder).
validationRules.wrapLink: Requires colUrl object with url property. Makes entire container clickable.
validationRules.minHeight: Minimum height for the container. Useful for creating visual presence or full-height sections.
validationRules.flexwrap: Controls wrapping behavior. Values: 'nowrap', 'wrap', 'wrap-reverse'. Use 'wrap' for grid-like layouts.
validationRules.alignWrap: Controls spacing between wrapped rows. Only works with flexwrap: 'wrap'. Values: 'flex-start', 'center', 'flex-end', 'space-between', 'space-around', 'stretch'.

warnings: CRITICAL: tp-container-inner is a child of tp-container. Always create tp-container parent first.
CRITICAL: Modern flexbox alternative to tp-row/tp-column. Don't mix legacy row/column structure with container-inner in same container.
Sticky on mobile (stickyMob: true) can cause layout issues and poor UX. Keep stickyMob: false.
topSpace and botSpace are different from sttopoffet. topSpace/botSpace are bottom offsets (default: 40), sttopoffet is top offset (default: 0).
flexChild (per-child controls) only works when showchild: true. Max recommended: 10 children for performance.
Width totals across multiple container-inner blocks should equal 100% (or less if using gap) to avoid wrapping issues.
flexDirection: 'column' makes flexAlign control horizontal alignment and flexJustify control vertical alignment (swapped).
flexreverse, flexRespreverse, flexTabreverse, flexMobreverse add '-reverse' suffix to flexDirection value.
When using wrapLink, entire container becomes clickable. Ensure child blocks don't have conflicting links.
NormalBg and HoverBg have separate openBg toggles. Set openBg: 1 for both to enable hover transition.
conInnerFilter (backdrop blur) is a Pro feature. Requires NormalBg with semi-transparent color for visual effect.
flexGap doesn't work in older browsers (pre-2021). Consider fallback padding for wider compatibility.
hideDesktop/hideTablet/hideMobile completely remove block from DOM. Use for device-specific layouts, not just hiding.
customCss should be used sparingly. Prefer using built-in attributes for maintainability.
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set openBg: 1 when defining NormalBg or HoverBg (background won't appear)
Setting flexDirection but not adjusting flexAlign/flexJustify (alignment behaves unexpectedly)
Using sticky without setting topSpace/botSpace offsets (sticky element overlaps content)
Enabling sticky on mobile devices (poor UX, layout breaks)
Mixing flexDirection responsive values inconsistently (e.g., row on md, but forgot to set column on xs)
Setting Width > 100% without accounting for Padding and parent gutterSpace (causes overflow)
Using flexwrap: 'wrap' without setting alignWrap (wrapped rows may not align as expected)
Enabling showchild: true without defining flexChild array (no effect)
Setting flexChild for more children than actually exist (extra definitions ignored, confusing)
Using wrapLink with colUrl but forgetting to set url property (link won't work)
Setting minHeight in em/rem units on containers with dynamic content (unexpected behavior)
Forgetting to set flexGap unit (defaults to px, may want rem for scalability)
Using sttopoffet instead of topSpace/botSpace for sticky offset (sttopoffet is top, not bottom)
Setting reverseWrap: true without understanding it adds '-reverse' suffix to flexwrap value
bestPractices: Always use responsive Width values: md for desktop, sm for tablet, xs: 100 for mobile (full width stacking)
Set flexDirection to 'column' on xs breakpoint for mobile-friendly stacking
Use flexGap instead of margin on child blocks for consistent spacing (cleaner, more maintainable)
For sticky containers, always disable on mobile: stickyMob: false (better UX)
Set topSpace and botSpace to 40-100px for sticky elements to avoid overlap with content
Use minHeight for hero sections and visual sections (creates presence), not for content containers
For centered content, use flexDirection: 'column', flexAlign: 'center', flexJustify: 'center'
For header/navigation bars, use flexDirection: 'row', flexAlign: 'center', flexJustify: 'space-between'
When using flexwrap: 'wrap', set alignWrap to control multi-row spacing
Use flexChild (per-child controls) only for complex layouts where standard flex isn't sufficient
For clickable containers, set both NormalBg and HoverBg to provide visual feedback on hover
Use semi-transparent backgrounds with conInnerFilter for modern frosted glass effects
Keep flexGap values responsive: larger on desktop (20-30px), smaller on mobile (10-15px)
Use ZIndex sparingly and document when used (prevents stacking context conflicts)
For grid-like card layouts, use flexwrap: 'wrap' with consistent Width across cards
Test sticky elements thoroughly - set stickyDes: true, stickyTab: false, stickyMob: false as default

layoutContext.childBlocks: Any content blocks (tp-heading, tp-image, tp-button, etc.)
layoutContext.siblingBlocks: Multiple tp-container-inner blocks can exist within same tp-container for multi-column layouts
layoutContext.gutterBehavior: Parent tp-container's gutterSpace becomes padding for this block. Width is calculated after padding applied.
layoutContext.widthCalculation: Width is percentage of parent tp-container minus parent's gutterSpace padding.
layoutContext.zIndexContext: Stacking context relative to parent tp-container. Use ZIndex to layer multiple container-inner blocks.
layoutContext.responsiveCascade: Responsive values cascade: md value used if sm/xs not set. Always set xs explicitly for mobile.
layoutContext.flexboxModel: Uses CSS flexbox. flexDirection controls main/cross axis. Row = horizontal main axis, Column = vertical main axis.

performanceConsiderations: Max 10 container-inner blocks per tp-container recommended (more causes layout recalculation overhead)
Sticky columns (stickycol: true) use JavaScript scroll listeners. Limit to 1-2 per page for performance.
Per-child flex controls (flexChild) add specificity overhead. Use only when necessary.
Backdrop filters (conInnerFilter with isbackdrop: true) are GPU-intensive. Limit to 1-2 per page.
Gradient backgrounds (HoverBg with gradients) can cause repaints on hover. Use solid colors for better performance.
Complex flexwrap grids with many items (>20) may cause layout thrashing. Consider pagination or lazy loading.
Multiple hover effects (HoverBg, HoverBorder, HoverBShadow) together can impact animation performance.
Custom CSS (customCss) can override optimizations. Keep custom styles minimal and scoped.
Responsive flexDirection changes trigger layout recalculation on resize. Expected behavior, but be aware.
Using Width in percentages is more performant than fixed px widths (avoids recalculation on parent resize)
accessibilityNotes: Flexbox order changes (flexOrder) don't change DOM order - screen readers read DOM order, not visual order
If using flexOrder to reorder content, ensure DOM order is semantic for screen readers
Clickable containers (wrapLink) should have descriptive inner text for screen readers to announce
When using hideDesktop/hideTablet/hideMobile, ensure critical content isn't hidden from assistive tech
Minimum touch target size 44x44px on mobile - ensure clickable containers meet this size
Color contrast on gradient backgrounds - test text readability with tools (WCAG AA minimum 4.5:1)
Sticky elements should not cover focusable content when keyboard navigating
